title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.3 FOUNDATIONAL SKILLS

description.narrative: Output 3 (Foundational skills): National and subnational governments and partners have enhanced capacity and mechanisms to improve children's basic literacy and numeracy skills in safe and inclusive learning environments., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: An increasing proportion of girls and boys, across the life cycle, especially the most disadvantaged, are learning in quality, safe and inclusive environments.

participating-org.narrative: PROGRAM KERJASAMA DITJEN BINA BANGD UNICEF

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3 (Foundational skills): National and subnational governments and partners have enhanced capacity and mechanisms to improvechildren?s basic literacy and numeracy skills in safe and inclusive learning environments.

description.narrative: The latest phase of the Early Grade Literacy (EGL) initiative is on track. In Papua Province, four more districts have committed to replicating the programme using their own budgetary resources; while a new province, South Sulawesi, has started implementing the programme as part of ‘safe return to learning’ efforts. The EGL pre-service teacher training module was revised, fully embedded into the pre-service teacher training curriculum of UNIMUDA University and shared with six other universities. An EGL scale-up roadmap and strategy was developed with strong support from the national government. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/12/2021
